alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 14 at 11:16AM MST until January 14 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST /MIDNIGHT CST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...North winds 30 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * WHERE...Along and south of Interstate 70 in eastern Colorado and northwest Kansas. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST /midnight CST/ this evening. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions are anticipated to be the primary impact, especially on west to east routes such as Interstate 70, where cross winds will be strongest. High profile vehicles will see the worst impacts. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...At 1102 AM MST, the National Weather Service in Goodland measured a north wind sustained at 44 mph gusting to 58 mph.
info.instruction: Wind of this magnitude may down trees, power lines, and damage property. If you must drive, watch for objects blowing across the roadway and into your path. Keep a safe distance from cars in adjacent lanes as strong gusts could suddenly push a vehicle outside its lane of travel. Take extra care in high-profile vehicles such as a truck, van, or SUV, or when towing a trailer, as these are more prone to be pushed or even flipped by high winds. High dust concentrations can aggravate asthma and cause respiratory problems, especially in children, the elderly, or those with pre- existing respiratory conditions. The Kansas Department of Health and Environment recommends taking preventative measures such as staying indoors or wearing protective breathing masks, if outside.
